errors.error_description: The Python version compatibility for PyRollbar v1.0.0 is vaguely listed as '3.x', which does not specify the exact supported minor versions and could lead to compatibility issues.
The setup instructions unnecessarily direct the user to manually install the `requests` library, which is already a dependency of `pyrollbar` and would be installed automatically.
correction_candidates: Follow the [Quick Start](https://docs.rollbar.com/docs/python#section-quick-start) instructions in our [Python SDK docs](https://docs.rollbar.com/docs/python) to install pyrollbar and configure it for your platform.

Ensure you have `pip` installed, then follow the [Quick Start](https://docs.rollbar.com/docs/python#section-quick-start) instructions in our [Python SDK docs](https://docs.rollbar.com/docs/python) to install pyrollbar and configure it for your platform.
First, install `pyrollbar` by running `pip install rollbar`, then follow the instructions in our [Python SDK docs](https://docs.rollbar.com/docs/python).
Remove the unnecessary `pip install requests` step from the setup instructions.
errors.golden_answer: Follow the [Quick Start](https://docs.rollbar.com/docs/python#section-quick-start) instructions in our [Python SDK docs](https://docs.rollbar.com/docs/python) to install pyrollbar and configure it for your platform.
